column1: # SOURCE: Engineering estimates for brackish groundwater pumping systems in arid regions
# DESCRIPTION: Pump system parameters for hydraulic energy calculations and infrastructure distance modeling
# UNITS: As specified in unit column

# LOGIC: Pump efficiency reflects combined pump+motor efficiency for submersible centrifugal pumps in brackish water applications. Default pipe and distance parameters are used when site-specific values are unavailable. Distance coefficients model average spacing between infrastructure components based on geometric distribution in a square region: E[d] = coeff * sqrt(A) / sqrt(n).
# DEPENDENCIES: Used by src/settings/calculations.py calculate_pumping_energy() and calculate_distances()
# ASSUMPTIONS: (1) PVC pipe material with friction factor 0.02
column3: (3) Distance coefficients calibrated for typical rural infrastructure placement

column4: Combined pump and motor efficiency for submersible centrifugal pumps
Default horizontal pipe distance from well to treatment/storage
Geometric distribution coefficient for well-to-treatment distance (wells tend to cluster near treatment)
Geometric distribution coefficient for treatment-to-farm distance (farms more spread out from central treatment)
